Detailed Record Table

Source: R/new_count_and_table.R
detailed_record_table.Rd

This function generates a formatted summary table that displays detailed counts for each citation source, including the number of records imported, distinct records, unique records, and non-unique records, along with contribution percentages.

Usage

detailed_record_table(data)

Arguments

data

A data frame containing detailed counts for each citation source. It must include columns such as Source, Records Imported, Distinct Records, Unique records, Non-unique Records, Source Contribution %, Source Unique Contribution %, and Source Unique %.

Value

A gt table object summarizing the detailed record counts for each citation source.

Details

The function uses the gt package to create a formatted table with labeled columns and footnotes that explain the meaning of each column. It also checks that the column names in the input data match the expected structure.

Examples

# Example usage with a sample dataset
sample_data <- data.frame(
  Source = c("Source1", "Source2", "Total"),
  `Records Imported` = c(100, 150, 250),
  `Distinct Records` = c(90, 140, 230),
  `Unique records` = c(50, 70, 120),
  `Non-unique Records` = c(40, 70, 110),
  `Source Contribution %` = c("39.1%", "60.9%", "100%"),
  `Source Unique Contribution %` = c("41.7%", "58.3%", "100%"),
  `Source Unique %` = c("55.6%", "50%", "52.2%")
)
detailed_record_table(sample_data)
#> Error in gt::cols_label(., `Records Imported` = "Records Imported", `Distinct Records` = "Distinct Records",     `Unique records` = "Unique records", `Non-unique Records` = "Non-unique Records",     `Source Contribution %` = "Records Contributed %", `Source Unique Contribution %` = "Unique Records Contributed %",     `Source Unique %` = "Unique Records %"): Can't find column `Records Imported` in the data.
#> ℹ The LHS should include column names or a tidyselect statement.
